pageContext.claim: “And when you go to a voting -- it would be wonderful if we had voting ID. And some states have that, and some states don't because they can't get it passed. Most states want it.”
pageContext.analysis: The majority of states have some kind of regulation on the books. Trump makes it sound like support for voter ID law is universal — it’s not. The 2016 Democratic Party platform, which is revised by party members every four years, states, "We will continue to fight against discriminatory voter identification laws, which disproportionately burden young voters, diverse communities, people of color, low-income families, people with disabilities, the elderly, and women."
